alert.note: Alert for Alpine (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 1:20PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of California and western Nevada, including the following counties and independent city, in California, Alpine, El Dorado, Nevada, Placer and Sierra. In western Nevada, Carson City, Douglas, Lyon, Storey and Washoe. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in urban, poor drainage, and locations where snow and debris may block water flow. Plan on water over roadways, as well as rock falls in canyons and steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 117 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - Steamboat Creek and East Fork of the Carson may experience minor flooding and near bankfull flows through this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
